titles.en: Chapter 57 – Fasting as an expiation for the oath
Chapter 57 – Fasting as an expiation for the oath

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ كُلُّ صَوْمٍ يُفَرَّقُ إِلَّا ثَلَاثَةَ أَيَّامٍ فِي كَفَّارَةِ الْيَمِينِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Abdullah Bin Sinan, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘Every Fast can be separated except for the three days regarding an expiation for the oath’.

verses.text: وَ عَنْهُ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنِ الْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ صِيَامُ ثَلَاثَةِ أَيَّامٍ فِي كَفَّارَةِ الْيَمِينِ مُتَتَابِعَاتٍ لَا يُفْصَلُ بَيْنَهُنَّ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
And from him, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hammad, from Al Halby, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The Fasts of the three days regarding an expiation for the oath are consecutive, there cannot be a gap in between them’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ الْوَشَّاءِ عَنْ أَبَانٍ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ زَيْدٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ السَّبْعَةُ الْأَيَّامِ وَ الثَّلَاثَةُ الْأَيَّامِ فِي الْحَجِّ لَا يُفَرَّقُ إِنَّمَا هِيَ بِمَنْزِلَةِ الثَّلَاثَةِ الْأَيَّامِ فِي الْيَمِينِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Al Hassan Bin Ali Al Washa, from Aban, from Al Husayn Bin Zayd, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The seven days, and the three days during the Hajj cannot be separated. But rather, these are at the status of the three days regarding the oath’.
